title: Analyzing f from graph of f' part - b

content.description: Let f be the function defined for x ≥ 0 with f(0)=5 and f', the first derivative of f, given by f'(x)= e(-x/4)}sin(x2). The graph of y = f'(x) is shown above.
content.question: On the interval 0 ≤ x ≤3 , find the value of x at which f has an absolute maximum. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: On the interval 0 ≤ x ≤3 , find the value of x at which f has an absolute maximum. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
